TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE , and resides in PERSON . He is represented by Mr L.J.L. Heukels , a lawyer practising in GPE , the GPE .
a. Particular circumstances of the present case

On DATE , in the context of an inspection by ORG ( Algemene Inspectie Dienst ) of ORG ( PERSON , PERSON ) , urine samples were taken from cattle on the applicant ’s farm and CARDINAL plastic bottles containing a suspect liquid found on the farm were seized . Subsequent tests of the urine samples indicated that CARDINAL cows had been administered the illegal substance clenbuterol . The CARDINAL plastic bottles seized were found to contain clenbuterol .

ORG The applicant was summoned to appear before the single - judge chamber for economic offences ( economische politierechter ) of ORG ( Arrondissementsrechtbank ) of GPE to answer charges of possession of beef cattle to which clenbuterol had been administered , of illegal possession of clenbuterol and of illegally administering that substance to animals . A hearing was held on DATE in the course of which the applicant gave evidence .

By judgment of DATE , the applicant was convicted of the first CARDINAL charges and sentenced to payment of a fine of ORG . CARDINAL . The CARDINAL cows and the CARDINAL plastic bottles were declared forfeit . The applicant filed an appeal with ORG ( Gerechtshof ) of GPE .

On DATE , a hearing was held before ORG . According to the formal record ( proces - verbaal ) of this hearing , the applicant ’s lawyer submitted his memorandum of oral pleading ( pleitnota ) to ORG and this document was added to the case - file .

In its judgment of DATE , ORG quashed the judgment of DATE , convicted the applicant of the first CARDINAL charges and sentenced him to payment of a fine of ORG . CARDINAL in respect of the first charge and a fine of ORG . CARDINAL in respect of the second charge . The CARDINAL cows and the CARDINAL plastic bottles were declared forfeit .

Insofar as the applicant complained that the technical manner in which the samples at issue had been taken , packed , sealed , transported and tested was contrary to his rights under LAW in that this provision is aimed at protecting individuals against arbitrary acts by public authorities , ORG held that no concrete doubts had arisen as regards the taking , packing , sealing , transporting and the testing of these samples . ORG added that it did failed to see the connection between LAW and the manner in which these samples were obtained and subsequently handled .

It considered that the mere speculations expressed by the applicant ’s lawyer at the hearing on appeal were insufficient to invoke the unreliability of the taking and subsequent handling of the samples at issue . It accepted the method used by ORG as containing sufficient guarantees .

ORG further rejected arguments raised by the applicant in relation to the findings of ORG of ORG in its judgment in case No . C - CARDINAL/CARDINAL and ORG DATE . It held that these arguments did not alter the fact that the first charge against the applicant constituted a punishable offence .

ORG further rejected a request by the defence to seek a preliminary ruling from ORG of ORG as regards the alleged incompatibility of the NORP rules in respect of growth inducing hormones with ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE . It held that no necessity to do so had appeared , as Member States of ORG are at liberty to issue stricter rules than those set by the Directive concerned .

The applicant filed an appeal in cassation with ORG ( PERSON ) and , by letter of DATE , his lawyer submitted the applicant ’s complaints in cassation to ORG . On DATE a hearing was held before ORG in the course of which it considered the applicant ’s complaints in cassation and the advisory opinion of PERSON ( ORG ) to ORG .
By letter of DATE to ORG , the applicant ’s lawyer reacted to the advisory opinion of the Procurator - General .

At some unspecified point in time , the Procurator - General submitted an additional advisory opinion to ORG , to which the applicant’ lawyer reacted in his letter of DATE to ORG . In this letter , the applicant ’s lawyer further requested to be informed of the hearing date in order to submit further oral explanations . He did not substantiate this request .

In its judgment of DATE , ORG stated that it had noted the contents of the applicant ’s letters of DATE and DATE , which had been submitted after the hearing on which the Procurator - General had submitted his advisory opinion and additional advisory opinion respectively .

ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaints in cassation , but following an ex officio examination of the case , quashed the judgment of DATE as regards the qualification of the first charge of which the applicant had been convicted and the pertaining part of the sentence , corrected this qualification itself and determined the sentence for this charge at payment of CARDINAL separate fines of ORG . CARDINAL each , the payment of ORG . CARDINAL of each fine being suspended pending a probation period of DATE .

Referring to Article PERSON of LAW ( Wet op de Rechterlijke Organisatie , " RO " ) , ORG rejected as not prompting a determination of legal issues in the interest of legal unity and legal development without stating any further reasons the applicant ’s complaints that certain arguments raised in connection with the application of ORG Directive CARDINAL/CARDINAL and which were stated in his memorandum of oral pleadings submitted to ORG in the course of the hearing held on DATE were incorrectly reproduced in the formal record of this hearing and that as a result thereof ORG had not dealt with these arguments in its judgment of DATE .

Insofar as the applicant complained that the NORP rules at issue , i.e. the complete prohibition of possession of cattle treated with growth inducing hormones , are incompatible with ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE and that ORG should have sought a preliminary ruling on the matter from ORG of ORG , ORG noted that this Directive had in the meantime been replaced by Directive CARDINAL of DATE . It rejected this complaint , holding that , according to the judgment of ORG of ORG of DATE ( No . C - CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) invoked by the applicant , CARDINAL may possess animals to which - in strict compliance with the Directives concerned - substances have been administered for the purpose of therapeutic treatment . However , in the present case it had not been submitted or established before the trial courts that the substance at issue had been administered for that specific purpose .

ORG also rejected the applicant ’s complaints under LAW in respect of the manner in which the inspection was carried out on DATE , including that the officials involved had started to take samples in the applicant ’s absence and without prior notification , holding that in cassation proceedings no complaints can be raised concerning facts and circumstances which have not been established and which have not been invoked before the trial courts .
b. Relevant domestic law and practice

The DATE Ordinance on substances with a sympathomimetic effect ( NORP stoffen met sympathico mimetische werking ) makes it illegal to administer animal medicines with a sympathomimetic effect containing clenbuterol to beef cattle older than DATE .

Pursuant to Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of that Ordinance it is illegal to have in stock , sell or purchase beef cattle to which such substances have been administered , and LAW CARDINAL makes it illegal to have in stock , sell or purchase their meat .
Clenbuterol is , moreover , an unregistered animal medicine the use or possession of which is prohibited by LAW ( PERSON ) .

The offences here described are economic offences for the purposes of LAW ( Wet op de Economische Delicten ) , which Act lays down particular rules for the prosecution and punishment of economic offences . Insofar as procedure is concerned , it is a lex specialis in relation to LAW , " ORG " ) , the provisions of the latter remaining applicable in so far as LAW does not provide otherwise .

A person convicted by the highest competent trial court may file an appeal in cassation with ORG ( Article CARDINAL ORG ) . An appeal in cassation is limited to points of law and procedural conformity ( LAW ) .

An appellant in cassation has the right to submit written grounds of appeal within DATE of lodging his appeal on points of law ( Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ORG ) , but an appeal in cassation is not automatically declared inadmissible if this has not been done . An appellant in cassation may further submit at the hearing before ORG grounds of appeal not filed at an earlier stage ( LAW ORG ) .

Following the ORG ’s judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( ORG . Court HR , judgment of DATE , Series A no . CARDINAL - B ) , ORG takes note , before determining an appeal in cassation , of the contents of any reaction from the side of the appellant in cassation to the advisory opinion of the Procurator - General or Advocate - General to ORG .
